snippet: The performances in “Art Song on Film” at Lincoln Center suggest that, rather than dispensing with illusion, lieder recitals demand a public construction of “self.”
abstract: Zachary Woolfe observes that performances in Art Song on Film, four-part video series at Lincoln Center celebrating lieder music, suggest that lieder recitals demand a public construction of self.
lead_paragraph: The performances in “Art Song on Film” at Lincoln Center suggest that, rather than dispensing with illusion, lieder recitals demand a public construction of “self.”

headline.print_headline: The Singer’s Artifice, Flickering on Film
headline.seo: Lincoln Center Screens Bygone Lieder Performances
headline.main: The Singer’s Artifice, Flickering on Film
